main_topic: Probability Theory: Random Variables, Distributions, and Expectation
description: This series of educational videos will cover the foundational concepts of probability theory, focusing on random variables, their distributions, and the concept of expectation. It is designed for undergraduate statistics students and will build progressively from basic definitions to more complex applications.

subtopics.title: Introduction to Probability and Random Variables
subtopics.description: This subtopic introduces the fundamental concepts of probability and random variables. It defines probability, sample spaces, and events. The concept of a random variable is introduced, distinguishing between discrete and continuous random variables. Key properties of random variables will be discussed, along with examples of each type.

subtopics.title: Discrete Probability Distributions
prerequisites: Introduction to Probability and Random Variables
subtopics.description: This subtopic focuses on discrete probability distributions. It covers the definition of a probability distribution function (PDF) and introduces common discrete distributions such as the binomial and Poisson distributions. Key properties, including the calculation of probabilities and the use of the PDF, are explained with examples.

subtopics.title: Continuous Probability Distributions
subtopics.description: This subtopic covers continuous probability distributions, defining the probability density function (PDF) and cumulative distribution function (CDF). It introduces common continuous distributions, such as the normal and exponential distributions, and discusses their properties and applications.

subtopics.title: Expectation and Variance of Random Variables
subtopics.description: This subtopic introduces the concepts of expectation (mean) and variance of random variables. It provides the formulas for calculating expectation and variance for both discrete and continuous random variables. Examples illustrate how to compute these values and their significance in probability theory.

subtopics.title: The Law of Large Numbers
prerequisites: Expectation and Variance of Random Variables
subtopics.description: This subtopic discusses the Law of Large Numbers, explaining its significance in probability theory. It covers the concept of convergence in probability and how it relates to the expectation of random variables. Examples demonstrate the practical implications of this law in real-world scenarios.

subtopics.title: Central Limit Theorem
subtopics.description: This subtopic covers the Central Limit Theorem (CLT), explaining its importance in statistics. It discusses the conditions under which the CLT holds and its implications for the distribution of sample means. Examples illustrate how the CLT is applied in statistical inference.

subtopics.title: Applications of Probability Distributions in Statistics
subtopics.description: This final subtopic explores the applications of probability distributions in statistics, including hypothesis testing and confidence intervals. It discusses how different distributions are used in statistical methods and provides examples of practical applications in various fields.
